New Records: Sri Lanka scored their lowest total in T20I history with 77 runs
Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 7 runs, his best performance in T20Is
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka's batting lineup collapsed, losing wickets at regular intervals
South Africa's bowlers delivered a masterclass in disciplined bowling
Pre-Game Insights: The match was anticipated to be one of the more competitive fixtures in Group D
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's performance raises questions about their preparation and adaptability
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York pitch proved challenging for the batsmen with inconsistent bounce and swing
The overall lowest total by any team in the T20 World Cup is 39, scored by the Netherlands against Sri Lanka in 2014
Others: Kusal Mendis was the top-scorer for Sri Lanka with 19 runs off 30 balls
This is the first time the New York pitch is being used in this tournament
